title: Welcome
content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

title: Offers​
content: And offer as whole may be in three states Accepted All supplied fields are valid. Partially Accepted The offer was accepted but some fields were omitted due to them being invalid. The effect of an omitted field is different depending on which field it is. Rejected We have a minimal set of required fields in order to show an offer on Prisjakt. If a required field is missing, the whole offer will be omitted from Prisjakt.

title: Fields​
content: A field is either valid or invalid. Invalid field data is always omitted when entering Prisjakts datastore. Valid A field is valid if it fulfills the validation rules of the field. Invalid A field is invalid if it fulfills the validation rules of the field.

title: Nested Fields​
content: Nested fields and lists may contain partially correct information, a nested field as whole: is considered valid if it fulfills the minimum requirements of the field as given by the validation rulesis considered invalid if it does not fulfill the minimum requirements of the field as given by the validatio rules

title: Optional Fields and Severity Levels​
content: An optional field may still be valid or invalid. If an optional field is submitted but the value is invalid, it will be noted in the validation report and the value would be omitted. It would have the same effect as not sending the offer at all.

title: Create a docs version​
content: Release a version 1.0 of your project: npm run docusaurus docs:version 1.0  The docs folder is copied into versioned_docs/version-1.0 and versions.json is created. Your docs now have 2 versions: 1.0 at http://localhost:3000/docs/ for the version 1.0 docscurrent at http://localhost:3000/docs/next/ for the upcoming, unreleased docs

title: Add a Version Dropdown​
content: To navigate seamlessly across versions, add a version dropdown. Modify the docusaurus.config.js file: docusaurus.config.js module.exports = { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'docsVersionDropdown', }, ], }, }, };  The docs version dropdown appears in your navbar:

title: Update an existing version​
content: It is possible to edit versioned docs in their respective folder: versioned_docs/version-1.0/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/hellodocs/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/next/hello

title: Build your site​
content: Build your site for production: npm run build  The static files are generated in the build folder.

title: Deploy your site​
content: Test your production build locally: npm run serve  The build folder is now served at http://localhost:3000/. You can now deploy the build folder almost anywhere easily, for free or very small cost (read the Deployment Guide).

title: Create your first React Page​
content: Create a file at src/pages/my-react-page.js: src/pages/my-react-page.js import React from 'react'; import Layout from '@theme/Layout'; export default function MyReactPage() { return ( <Layout> <h1>My React page</h1> <p>This is a React page</p> </Layout> ); }  A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-react-page.

title: Create your first Markdown Page​
content: Create a file at src/pages/my-markdown-page.md: src/pages/my-markdown-page.md # My Markdown page This is a Markdown page  A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-markdown-page.

title: Create your first Post​
content: Create a file at blog/2021-02-28-greetings.md: blog/2021-02-28-greetings.md --- slug: greetings title: Greetings! authors: - name: Joel Marcey title: Co-creator of Docusaurus 1 url: https://github.com/JoelMarcey image_url: https://github.com/JoelMarcey.png - name: Sébastien Lorber title: Docusaurus maintainer url: https://sebastienlorber.com image_url: https://github.com/slorber.png tags: [greetings] --- Congratulations, you have made your first post! Feel free to play around and edit this post as much you like.  A new blog post is now available at http://localhost:3000/blog/greetings.

title: Create your first Doc​
content: Create a Markdown file at docs/hello.md: docs/hello.md # Hello This is my **first Docusaurus document**!  A new document is now available at http://localhost:3000/docs/hello.

title: Configure the Sidebar​
content: Docusaurus automatically creates a sidebar from the docs folder. Add metadata to customize the sidebar label and position: docs/hello.md --- sidebar_label: 'Hi!' sidebar_position: 3 --- # Hello This is my **first Docusaurus document**!  It is also possible to create your sidebar explicitly in sidebars.js: sidebars.js module.exports = { tutorialSidebar: [ 'intro', 'hello', { type: 'category', label: 'Tutorial', items: ['tutorial-basics/create-a-document'], }, ], };

title: Configure i18n​
content: Modify docusaurus.config.js to add support for the fr locale: docusaurus.config.js module.exports = { i18n: { defaultLocale: 'en', locales: ['en', 'fr'], }, };

title: Translate a doc​
content: Copy the docs/intro.md file to the i18n/fr folder: mkdir -p i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/ cp docs/intro.md i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md  Translate i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md in French.

title: Start your localized site​
content: Start your site on the French locale: npm run start -- --locale fr  Your localized site is accessible at http://localhost:3000/fr/ and the Getting Started page is translated. caution In development, you can only use one locale at a same time.

title: Add a Locale Dropdown​
content: To navigate seamlessly across languages, add a locale dropdown. Modify the docusaurus.config.js file: docusaurus.config.js module.exports = { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'localeDropdown', }, ], }, }, };  The locale dropdown now appears in your navbar:

title: Build your localized site​
content: Build your site for a specific locale: npm run build -- --locale fr  Or build your site to include all the locales at once: npm run build

title: Front Matter​
content: Markdown documents have metadata at the top called Front Matter: my-doc.md --- id: my-doc-id title: My document title description: My document description slug: /my-custom-url --- ## Markdown heading Markdown text with [links](./hello.md)

title: Links​
content: Regular Markdown links are supported, using url paths or relative file paths. Let's see how to [Create a page](/create-a-page).  Let's see how to [Create a page](./create-a-page.md).  Result: Let's see how to Create a page.

title: Images​
content: Regular Markdown images are supported. You can use absolute paths to reference images in the static directory (static/img/docusaurus.png): ![Docusaurus logo](/img/docusaurus.png)   You can reference images relative to the current file as well, as shown in the extra guides.

title: Code Blocks​
content: Markdown code blocks are supported with Syntax highlighting. ```jsx title="src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js" function HelloDocusaurus() { return ( <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1> ) } ```  src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js function HelloDocusaurus() { return <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1>; }

title: Admonitions​
content: Docusaurus has a special syntax to create admonitions and callouts: :::tip My tip Use this awesome feature option ::: :::danger Take care This action is dangerous :::  My tip Use this awesome feature option Take care This action is dangerous

title: MDX and React Components​
content: MDX can make your documentation more interactive and allows using any React components inside Markdown: export const Highlight = ({children, color}) => ( <span style={{ backgroundColor: color, borderRadius: '20px', color: '#fff', padding: '10px', cursor: 'pointer', }} onClick={() => { alert(`You clicked the color ${color} with label ${children}`) }}> {children} </span> ); This is <Highlight color="#25c2a0">Docusaurus green</Highlight> ! This is <Highlight color="#1877F2">Facebook blue</Highlight> !  This is Docusaurus green ! This is Facebook blue !

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Using this attribute is strongly recommended for Fashion and Beauty categories. Add it to improve search results and listing.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Include up to 3 different color in format blue/black/green where the first is primary, and the other two secondaryDon't use numbers and HTML color codingDon't use phrases describing other product properties like design, pattern, size etc

title: Allowed Values​
content: Use the same color as in your product page

title: Format​
content: Type: List[String]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 3Length: up to 40 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:color></g:color> <g:color>red</g:color> <g:color>green</g:color> <g:color>blue</g:color> <g:color>red/green/blue</g:color> <g:color>RED/GREEN/BLUE</g:color>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example color "" color red color green color blue color red/green/blue color RED/GREEN/BLUE

title: Invalid XML Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code <g:color>aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 40 characters value)</g:color> validation_invalid_length <g:color>black/mint/blue/white</g:color> validation_too_many_repetitions

title: Invalid CSV Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code color aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 40 characters value) validation_invalid_length color black/mint/blue/white validation_too_many_repetitions

content: https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/6324487

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. It is recommended to use this attribute in Fashion categories. Add it to improve search results and listing.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Don't use values that do not describe material None, N/A

title: Allowed Values​
content: Include the main fabric or materialAdd up to 3 materials separated by slash Cotton/Leather

title: Format​
content: Type: List[String]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 3

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:material>Cotton</g:material> <g:material>Cotton/Leather</g:material>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example material Cotton material Cotton/Leather

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Please note that product_type is required if google_product_category is not present.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Examples Via Include Files​
content: Check A Check B {{#include product_type_xml_examples.xml}}  {{#include product_type_csv_examples.csv}}

title: Specification Details​
content: Avoid adding categories like Apple, Sale, Black Friday 2023Full category path helps with product categorization in our system. This means that product with good category path will be indexed faster.

title: Allowed Values​
content: Use full category pathAdd single categoryAdd category that clearly points to what type of products it isUse only one attribute of this type per product

title: Format​
content: Type: StringEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: noLength: up to 255 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:product_type></g:product_type> <g:product_type>Sporting Goods &gt; Athletics &gt; Figure Skating &amp; Hockey &gt; Ice Skates</g:product_type> <g:product_type>computer_accessories</g:product_type> <g:product_type>type 1</g:product_type> <g:product_type>type 2</g:product_type>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example product_type "" product_type Sporting Goods > Athletics > Figure Skating & Hockey > Ice Skates product_type computer_accessories product_type "type 1,type 2"

title: Invalid XML Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code <g:product_type>aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 256 characters value)</g:product_type> validation_invalid_length

title: Invalid CSV Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code product_type aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 256 characters value) validation_invalid_length

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. In this attribute add all structured information about the product.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Make sure data is properly formatted - no HTML tags inside attributesDo not add product descriptionOnly add confirmed information

title: Allowed Values​
content: Do not add information covered in other attributes

title: Format​
content: Type: List[Nested]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 1000Subattributes: attribute_name (required) - String, up to 140 characters - attribute_value (required) - String, up to 1000 characters - section_name (required) - String, up to 140 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:product_detail> <g:attribute_name>Diagonal Size</g:attribute_name> <g:attribute_value>2.5</g:attribute_value> <g:section_name>Display</g:section_name> </g:product_detail> <g:product_detail> <g:attribute_name>memory</g:attribute_name> <g:attribute_value>500 GB</g:attribute_value> <g:section_name>disc</g:section_name> </g:product_detail>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example product_detail(section_name:attribute_name:attribute_value) Display:Diagonal Size:2.5 product_detail(section_name:attribute_name:attribute_value) disc:memory:500 GB

title: Invalid XML Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code <g:product_detail> <g:section_name>x</g:section_name> </g:product_detail> validation_missing_field <g:product_detail> <g:attribute_name>memory</g:attribute_name> <g:attribute_value>500 GB</g:attribute_value> <g:section_name> (more than 1000 characters value)</g:section_name> </g:product_detail> validation_invalid_length

title: Invalid CSV Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code product_detail(section_name) x validation_missing_field product_detail(section_name:attribute_name:attribute_value)  (more than 1000 characters value):memory:500 GB validation_invalid_length

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Shipping label allows mapping your inventory to specific shipping service.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Suggested types of products that should get own shipping_label: oversized products (i.e. white goods), perishable products (i.e. groceries)

title: Allowed Values​
content: Choose your own values for shipping labels based on your inventoryAdd up to 10 shipping labels separated by slash

title: Format​
content: Type: List[String]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 10

title: Valid XML Examples​

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Add this information if you know to which Prisjakt product we should match your product. Prisjakt XML namespace definition is available at https://storage.googleapis.com/prisjakt-namespace/ns

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Adding this will give you control over indexing process

title: Allowed Values​
content: Only digits are allowed

title: Format​
content: Type: StringEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: noLength: up to 50 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <pj:prisjakt_id>1</pj:prisjakt_id> <pj:prisjakt_id>123</pj:prisjakt_id>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example prisjakt_id 1 prisjakt_id 123

content: Invalid example Resulting error code prisjakt_id foo validation_not_integer prisjakt_id aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 50 characters value) validation_invalid_length

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Please note, that shipping is required for all products sold on French market. The shipping attribute is used to specify the cost of shipping of a product.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: It's highly recommended as an offer, as without shipping it's less attractive for the userIt is also recommended to include this cost to improve conversionKeep shipping information as precise as possible. Add multiple shipping attributes if shipping cost or time varies for different country, region or service.Don't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part of the shipping price, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

title: Allowed Values​
content: Submit complete shipping informationHandling time and transit time should be specified in days.Overestimate if you can't provide accurate shipping costSubmit shipping cost including VAT, use local currencyIf you provide information about handling or transit time then min_handling_time should be lesser or equal to max_handling_time and min_transit_time should be lesser or equal to max_transit_time

title: Format​
content: Type: List[Nested]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 100Subattributes: country (required) - String, ISO 3166 alpha-2 code - price (required) - Price, Number, currency (ISO 4217) and decimal point - max_handling_time (optional) - Integer - max_transit_time (optional) - Integer - min_handling_time (optional) - Integer - min_transit_time (optional) - Integer - region (optional) - String, up to 50 characters - service (optional) - String, up to 50 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:shipping> <g:country>SE</g:country> <g:price>5 SEK</g:price> <g:region>New York</g:region> <g:service>DHL</g:service> </g:shipping> <g:shipping> <g:country>SE</g:country> <g:price>0 GBP</g:price> <g:region>London</g:region> <g:service>DHL</g:service> </g:shipping> <g:shipping> <g:country>SE</g:country> <g:max_handling_time>5</g:max_handling_time> <g:max_transit_time>3</g:max_transit_time> <g:min_handling_time>1</g:min_handling_time> <g:min_transit_time>1</g:min_transit_time> <g:price>5.00 SEK</g:price> <g:region>Skåne</g:region> <g:service>DHL</g:service> </g:shipping>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example shipping(country:region:service:price) SE:New York:DHL:5 SEK shipping(country:region:service:price) SE:London:DHL:0 GBP shipping(country:region:service:price:min_handling_time:max_handling_time:min_transit_time:max_transit_time) SE:Skåne:DHL:5.00 SEK:1:5:1:3

title: Invalid XML Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code <g:shipping> <g:country></g:country> <g:min_handling_time>-1</g:min_handling_time> <g:price>5 SEK</g:price> <g:region>New York</g:region> <g:service>DHL</g:service> </g:shipping> validation_null_value <g:shipping> <g:country>SE</g:country> <g:min_handling_time>-1</g:min_handling_time> <g:price></g:price> <g:region>New York</g:region> <g:service>DHL</g:service> </g:shipping> validation_null_value

title: Description​

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Use the most nested category possible, avoid using root categoriesThis information helps us to make the products searchable for the usersUse full category path or respective category id from the list

title: Allowed Values​
content: Use only one attribute of this type per product

title: Format​
content: Type: StringEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: no

title: Description​
content: This attribute is required. It should contain the full product name. The title is used to clearly state what product your shop is selling. It's the most important attribute for Prisjakt to be able to index your product/offer correctly. It should contain a manufacturer name along with product name or model. Including size, color and gender is recommended for product types that specifies this.

title: Requirements​
content: required

title: Specification Details​
content: It should contain the full product name (it should be easy to identify the product by title)Use the same title as it is present on your product pageAdd variant information if applicable: colour, size, gender etc.Do not use HTML tag - Do not include promotional textDo not use tabs or extra spacesDo not write detailed information in title, this belongs in the description attributePreferred syntax [brand] + [model name] + [additional product information]Use language of the specific market where the product is being sold (for better user experience)

title: Allowed Values​
content: Use only one title attribute per product

title: Format​
content: Type: StringEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: noLength: from 1 up to 255 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:title>Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G</g:title>

title: Valid CSV Examples​
content: Valid example title Samsung Galaxy S8 Black 128G

title: Invalid XML Examples​

title: Invalid CSV Examples​
content: Invalid example Resulting error code title aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa (more than 256 characters value) validation_invalid_length title "" validation_null_value

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Used to add additional image links. The images may include different angles, colours etc. This gives the user the option to view different variants that might exist for a product.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Use stable url (for better user experience)Use URL to pre-selected product variants (if applicable)Use as few redirects as possible (for better user experience)Replace symbols or spaces with URL encoded entities, meaning you should replace for instance ? with %3F

title: Allowed Values​
content: Standard: RFC 3986

title: Format​
content: Type: List[Url]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 10Length: up to 2047 characters

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. It should be the same as the price value on your product page with active membership program. Prisjakt XML namespace definition is available at https://storage.googleapis.com/prisjakt-namespace/ns

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Price value must be greater than 0Don't provide more than 2 digits after decimal pointDon't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

title: Allowed Values​
content: Mixed values: number, currency (ISO 4217) and decimal pointOnly one price value per product followed by one currency unit, or one currency unit followed by only one price value per product

title: Format​
content: Type: PriceEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: no

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <pj:member_price>100 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>SEK 100</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>99.99 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>99,99 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>10,000.00 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>10 000.00 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>10.000 SEK</pj:member_price> <pj:member_price>1.144.000 SEK</pj:member_price>

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Include any additional fees that are applied during the checkout process. This should be used to eliminate "hidden fees" that might not be included in the product's specific price. Such as "pant" in Sweden, green taxation and similar.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Include VAT in the priceAdd ISO 4217 currency codeDon't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part in fee_value, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

title: Allowed Values​
content: Submit complete additional fee informationOverestimate if you can't provide accurate additional fee costSubmit additional fee cost including VAT, use local currency

title: Format​
content: Type: List[Nested]Encoding: UTF-8Repeatable: yes, up to 3Subattributes: fee_name (required) - String - fee_value (required) - Price, Number, currency (ISO 4217) and decimal point

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Use it to indicate if the product can be bought at a different price than a sales or regular price eg. discount coupon can be applied. Membership price is excluded (We have different separated field for this type of promotion - 'member_price'.)

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Add the full promotion priceIf there are discount coupons, add the product price, do not add the discount percentageDon't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part of the promotion price, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

title: Allowed Values​
content: Submit complete promotion information

title: Format​

title: Description​
content: This attribute is required. Identifier should be unique for every product and not be changed or re-used for other products, a good practice is to use SKUs as ids since they are unique.

title: Requirements​
content: required

title: Specification Details​
content: It must be unique (If not unique, your product will be indexed incorrectly)It must be case-insensitive (Casing will not make IDs unique, abc123 = ABC123)It cannot be re-used (If re-used, your product might end up indexed to the wrong Prisjakt product)It cannot change (If changed, the product will need to be indexed again)It must follow UTF-8 specs

title: Allowed Values​
content: Value must be uniqueNumbers, letters (case insensitive), dash (-) and underscore (_)

title: Format​
content: Type: StringEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: noLength: from 1 up to 36 characters

title: Description​
content: This attribute is required. It should be the same as the price value on your product page. It should contain sale price if sale_price attribute is not used.

title: Requirements​
content: required

title: Specification Details​
content: Price attribute should contain both price (value) and currency (unit)Make sure the price value and currency in the feed matches value and currency on your product pageDon't include any additional cost in the price (e.g shipping cost)Price value must be greater than 0Don't provide more than 2 digits after decimal pointDon't provide comma or point as separator for both thousands and fractional part, i.e. we don't support 1,000,00 SEK and 1.000.00 SEK formats

title: Allowed Values​
content: Mixed values: number, currency (ISO 4217) and decimal pointOnly one price value per product followed by one currency unit, or one currency unit followed by only one price value per product

title: Format​
content: Type: PriceEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: no

title: Valid XML Examples​

title: Description​
content: Use the GTIN attribute to submit a Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) | GS1. A GTIN uniquely identifies your product. GTIN enables automated product classification therefore any new products added to the feed will be indexed automaticallyWe're strictly following UPC/EAN/JAN/ISBN and ITF-14 Effects When Used Including this will help indexing your products faster on Pricespy. Effects When Omitted Process time will be slower.

title: Validation Rules​
content: If any of these rules are broken, it is the same as if this field would be omitted. Please see severity levels for more details. Use only one attribute of this type per productLength should be one of 0, 8, 12, 13, or 14 digits (UPC, EAN, JAN, or ISBN)Make sure that the check digit is present and correct using the GS1 Check digit calculatorDon’t submit a GTIN in the restricted ranges. Restricted ranges have the following prefixes: 02, 04, or 2Don’t submit a GTIN in the coupon ranges. Coupons have the following GS1 prefixes ranges: 05, 98–99Must be a integer number without decimals

title: Getting Started​
content: Get started by creating a new site. Or try Docusaurus immediately with docusaurus.new.

title: What you'll need​
content: Node.js version 16.14 or above: When installing Node.js, you are recommended to check all checkboxes related to dependencies.

title: Generate a new site​
content: Generate a new Docusaurus site using the classic template. The classic template will automatically be added to your project after you run the command: npm init docusaurus@latest my-website classic  You can type this command into Command Prompt, Powershell, Terminal, or any other integrated terminal of your code editor. The command also installs all necessary dependencies you need to run Docusaurus.

title: Start your site​
content: Run the development server: cd my-website npm run start  The cd command changes the directory you're working with. In order to work with your newly created Docusaurus site, you'll need to navigate the terminal there. The npm run start command builds your website locally and serves it through a development server, ready for you to view at http://localhost:3000/. Open docs/intro.md (this page) and edit some lines: the site reloads automatically and displays your changes.

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Add this attribute if you're using affiliate platform tracking.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Use stable url (for better user experience)Use URL to pre-selected product variants (if applicable)Use as few redirects as possible (for better user experience)Replace symbols or spaces with URL encoded entities, meaning you should replace for instance ? with %3F

title: Allowed Values​
content: Start with http or httpsURL encodedOnly one value per product

title: Format​
content: Type: UrlEncoding: UTF-8Repeatable: noLength: up to 2047 characters

title: Valid XML Examples​
content: Valid example <g:affiliate_link></g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>http://example.com/link</g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>https://example.com/link</g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>https://example.com/link(black)_(large)</g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>https://example.com/link#foo</g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>https://example.com/link?utm_source=1&amp;utm_medium=2</g:affiliate_link> <g:affiliate_link>http://example.com/link-%E2%84%A2-mu-20%C2%B5m</g:affiliate_link>

title: Description​
content: This attribute is optional. Add it to improve search results and listing. If you have more then one image you can use the additional_image_link attribute to include more.

title: Requirements​
content: optional

title: Specification Details​
content: Image link helps user to find the right product, especially in case of thin categoriesUse only one attribute of this type per product

title: Allowed Values​
content: Start with http or httpsURL encodedIt should not have any watermarks or any other types of manufacturer or shop logosIt should be of the model as mentioned in the product name, and other attributes for example color and size should also be mentioned

title: Format​
